  • Method Details

    • emptyIterator

      public static <E> Iterator<E> emptyIterator()
      Returns an empty iterator over no elements
      Type Parameters:
      E - type of items
      Returns:
      empty Iterator

    • size

      public static int size​(Iterator<?> iterator)
      Returns the number of items the iterator has. Null safe.
      Parameters:
      iterator - an iterator. can be null
      Returns:
      number of items

    • toList

      public static <T> List<T> toList​(Iterator<? extends T> iterator, int estimatedSize)
      Returns a list of the items the iterator contains.

      The iterator is traversed and the values are stored in an ArrayList.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the item type
      Parameters:
      iterator - the iterator. can't be null
      estimatedSize - starting size of the ArrayList
      Returns:
      list of the iterator items
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if iter is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if estimatedSize is less than 1

    • toList

      public static <T> List<T> toList​(Iterator<? extends T> iterator)
      Returns a list of the items the iterator contains.

      The iterator is traversed and the values are stored in an ArrayList.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the item type
      Parameters:
      iterator - the iterator. can't be null
      Returns:
      list of the iterator items
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if iter is null

    • toArray

      public static Object[] toArray​(Iterator<?> iterator)
      Returns an array of the items in the iterator.

      As the iterator is traversed an ArrayList of the values is created and then it is converted to an array.

      Parameters:
      iterator - the iterator to convert. can't be null.
      Returns:
      array of the items in the iterator
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if iterator is null

    • toArray

      public static <T> T[] toArray​(Iterator<? extends T> iterator, Class<T> arrayClass)
      Returns an array of the items in the iterator.

      As the iterator is traversed an ArrayList of the values is created and then it is converted to an array.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the item type
      Parameters:
      iterator - the iterator to convert. can't be null.
      arrayClass - the class of the array to create. can't be null.
      Returns:
      array of the items in the iterator.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if iterator is null
      ArrayStoreExcetpion - if arrayClass is invalid

    • get

      public static <T> T get​(Iterator<T> iterator, int index)
      Returns the element at index in the Iterator.

      The Iterator is moved to index as a side effect.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the item type
      Parameters:
      iterator - the iterator
      index - the index
      Returns:
      item at the specified index
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the iterator is null
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is invalid

    • first

      public static <T> T first​(Iterator<T> iterator)
      Returns the first item in the iterator.

      The Iterator is moved to 0 as a side effect.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the item type
      Parameters:
      iterator - the iterator
      Returns:
      the first item
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if there is no first item

    • isEmpty

      public static boolean isEmpty​(Iterator<?> iterator)
      Checks if the Iterator is empty .

      A null Iterator returns true.

      Parameters:
      iterator - the iterator to check
      Returns:
      true if Iterator is empty or null and false otherwise

    • asIterable

      public static <T> Iterable<T> asIterable​(Iterator<T> iterator)
      Returns a single use wrapper Iterable of the iterator. Null safe.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the item type
      Parameters:
      iterator - the iterator to wrap. can be null.
      Returns:
      single use wrapper Iterable of iterator

    • toString

      public static <T> String toString​(Iterator<T> iterator)
      Returns a string representation of the iterator.

      The string represenation consists of the items of the iterator enclosed between square brackets [] and seperated by a comma and space ", ".

      Type Parameters:
      T - the item type
      Parameters:
      iterator - the iterator
      Returns:
      string representation of iterator
